# The Birth of an Idea...[*the MAPS project*]{style="color: blue;"}

::: incremental
-   From MAPS, Other studies:
-   [Southern Africa's Food Systems deficient in protein, micro-nutrients]{style="color: blue;"}.
    -   Malawi, South Africa, Zimbabwe, Zambia, etc
-   MAPS simulation:
    -   [lentils, most efficient in supplying these nutrients]{style="color: blue;"}.
:::

# Why Regional Food Systems are Failing...[*interlocking, cross-disciplinary challenges*]{style="color: blue;"}

-   Government policies
-   Cropping practices
-   Climate change

## *Government Policies*

::: incremental
-   Policies skewing crops produced:
    -   [establishment of grain marketing boards for maize]{style="color: blue;"}
    -   reinforced by maize production packages
    -   [promotion of tobacco to earn foreign currency]{style="color: blue;"}
    -   through numerous contracting companies offering tobacco crop packages
:::

## *Cropping Practices.....poor soil husbandry*

::: incremental
-   [most soils in region have low pH, acidic:]{style="color: blue;"}
    -   due to continuous fertilizer use,
    -   without promoting liming to ameliorate the problem,
-   [Hence:]{style="color: blue;"}
    -   prevalence of low crop yields,
    -   and inadequate food production,
    -   [due to reduced fertilizer efficiency, and Al toxicity.]{style="color: blue;"}
:::

## *Lack of Rotations in Cropping Systems*

::: incremental
-   [for millennia, legume-cereal rotations have boosted soil fertility, particularly for resource poor farmers]{style="color: blue;"}
-   yet, not widely practiced by the resource poor in southern Africa
    -   partly due to govt policies mentioned above,
    -   that drive maize and tobacco production
    -   [and lack of viable alternative cash crops]{style="color: blue;"}
:::

## *Climate change...*

::: incremental
-   [Southern Africa, a hot spot of climate change]{style="color: blue;"}
    -   due to its geographical location.
-   [Hence:]{style="color: blue;"}
    -   frequent erratic rains, low rainfall, droughts
    -   frequent heat waves,
    -   frequent crop failures...hunger...poverty,
    -   [widespread nutrient deficiencies.]{style="color: blue;"}
:::

# A Pulse Solution...[*lentils, key to complex challenges*]{style="color: blue;"}

::: incremental
-   [a novel crop in southern Africa]{style="color: blue;"}
-   [a crop of multiple attributes]{style="color: blue;"}
:::

## Lentil Attribute...*Lentils improve human health*

::: incremental
-   lentils are [nutritious:]{style="color: blue;"}
    -   rich in [protein]{style="color: blue;"},
    -   rich in complex [carbohydrates]{style="color: blue;"},
    -   rich in minerals: e.g., [K, Mg, Fe, Se, folate, Ca, P, Zn]{style="color: blue;"}
    -   richest in [fiber]{style="color: blue;"}, which is good for digestion and regulating insulin levels
:::

## Lentil Attribute...*Lentils improve soil health*

::: incremental
-   lentils [encourage]{style="color: blue;"} good soil husbandry
    -   farmers have to add [lime]{style="color: blue;"} to [ameliorate]{style="color: blue;"} soil acidity,
    -   because lentils are very sensitive to acidic soils
:::

## Lentil Attribute...*Lentils are water efficient*

::: incremental
-   [lentil crops require minimal rainfall]{style="color: blue;"}
    -   about 300 - 500 mm, annually
    -   maize requires about double this
-   [hence, lentils better adapt to short rainfall seasons due to climate change]{style="color: blue;"}
-   some lentil varieties are drought and heat tolerant
    -   [adapt well to the climate change induced frequent droughts]{style="color: blue;"}
:::

## Lentil Attribute...*Lentils reduce domestic energy consumption*

::: incremental
-   [lentils cook in 10-30 minutes]{style="color: blue;"},
    -   which saves energy, reducing deforestation,
-   [Firewood, a primary source of domestic energy in southern Africa]{style="color: blue;"}
    -   due to low generation capacity of electricity
    -   and a large, and poor rural population
-   Hence, [the widespread deforestation, landscape degradation, soil erosion, and siltation of water systems and reservoirs]{style="color: blue;"} in the region
:::

## Lentil Attribute...*Lentils improve animal health*

::: incremental
-   lentil straw is better than cereal straw
    -   because is more [palatable]{style="color: blue;"},
    -   because is higher in [digestibility]{style="color: blue;"},
    -   and higher in nutrients: [protein, Ca, and P]{style="color: blue;"}
-   [there are forage lentil lines that produce high biomass yields]{style="color: blue;"}
:::

## Lentil Attributes...*Lentils, a profitable cash crop*

::: incremental
-   [Lentils have a billion pound (£) international market]{style="color: blue;"}
    -   major consumers in south Asia
    -   where lentils are integral to daily diets
-   [Canada, the world's largest producer, exporter]{style="color: blue;"}
    -   produced mainly by large prairie farmers
-   [India, the world's largest importer, consumer, and second largest producer]{style="color: blue;"}
    -   produced mainly by small holder farmers
:::

# Introducing lentils in Southern Africa...[*a cross-disciplinary approach*]{style="color: blue;"}

## A Food Systems Approach...

::: incremental
-   [Cross-disciplinary studies:]{style="color: blue;"}

-   [Production:]{style="color: blue;"}

-   [Marketing:]{style="color: blue;"}
